notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.text: All information products included in https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics are provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text:
Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to cause a current Arena
                      session to fault or enter a denial-of-service (DoS) state, allowing the attacker to run arbitrary
                      code.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text:
CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this
                      vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to
                      deploying defensive measures.
                      CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended
                        practices on the ICS webpage onus-cert.gov.
                      Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving
                        Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information
                      Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted
                        Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
                      Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal
                      procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA also recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social
                      engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities. This vulnerability is not exploitable remotely.
notes.title: Exploitability

document.title: Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation Software (Update B)

revision_history.summary: ICSA-19-213-05 Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation Software
ICSA-19-213-05 Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation Software (Update A)
ICSA-19-213-05 Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation Software (Update B)

product.name: Arena Simulation Software for Manufacturing Cat. 9502-Ax: Versions 16.00.00 and earlier

branches.name: Arena Simulation Software for Manufacturing Cat. 9502-Ax

notes.text:
A maliciously crafted Arena file opened by an unsuspecting user may result in the application
                      crashing or the execution of arbitrary code.CVE-2019-13510 has
                      been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.6 has been assigned; the CVSS
                      vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Rockwell Automation has released Version 16.00.01 of Arena Simulation Software to address the reported vulnerabilities.
Do not open untrusted .doe files with Arena Simulation Software.
Ensure all software is run as a User and not as an Administrator to minimize the impact of malicious code on the infected system.
Use trusted software, software patches, anti-virus/anti-malware programs, and interact only with trusted websites and attachments
For more information please see the Rockwell Automation security advisory (login required).

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text:
A maliciously crafted Arena file opened by an unsuspecting user may result in the limited
                      exposure of information related to the targeted workstation.CVE-2019-13511 has
                      been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 3.3 has been assigned; the CVSS
                      vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

For more information please see the Rockwell Automation security advisory (login required).

notes.text:
A maliciously crafted Arena file opened by an unsuspecting user may result in the use of a
                      pointer that has not been initialized. CVE-2019-13527 has
                      been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been assigned; the CVSS
                      vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
                    . --------- End Update B Part 2 of 2 ---------CVE-2019-13527 has
                      been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been assigned; the CVSS
                      vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
